intro: Tabebuia erosa, commonly known as the pink trumpet tree, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The tree has a spreading canopy and produces fruit that splits open to release its seeds. Its bark is often used in traditional medicine, and it is valued for its ornamental appeal in landscaping. The plant thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, preferring well-drained soil and full sun.
